Topic.Title: Nexus 7 (2nd Gen) Delayed to July. Why?

Message.Msg: According to Androidanthority, a Google exec (head of Google Chrome) told "Wired" that this would not be a conference covering new Android products/hardware. Rather, it would focus on new software and services, making it a developers' conference. So....it was all planned this way. I think there is zero chance Google would make a last minute switch to incorporate T4 - two many reasons against it, and the complete specs have leaked from an "official source"

Topic.Title: Nexus 7 (2nd Gen) Delayed to July. Why?

Message.Msg: Oooops, the source: androidauthorityDOTcom/android-4-3-nexus-7-32-nexus-4-lte-x-phone-google-smartwatch-missing-210668/

Topic.Title: Nexus 7 (2nd Gen) Delayed to July. Why?

Message.Msg: Sell tablets below cost and upset OEM customers like Acer, Toshiba, even Asus, that were undoubtedly hurt last year by N7, is not something that NVIDIA'd want to take part in. And Google may silently quit this game too, by picking S4Pro instead of newer S600's etc. Maybe the correct tablet price is $350, being $200 too cheap and $500 too expensive. Of course NVIDIA will eventually sell its own tablets if OEMs don't react, and that's what Shield is testing. I think we all know that NVIDIA enjoys brand recognition, but investors are impatient by now. The other major issue is the OS, tablets are different to smartphones and I'm not sure if Android takes that in. And if Win RT vs Android tablets specs are compared, it can be seen that they're charging 200$ for Windows+Office, which isn't giving anything for free.

Topic.Title: "Google To Announce Next Nexus 7 Tomorrow"

Message.Msg: You posted this many times, often being the sole person posting follow-ups. You must have considered the win or loss of the Nexus 7 deal to be very, very important. Now that the Tegra remains in the Nexus 7, at least for a few more months, didt that change your opinion? The Nexus 7 has recently been made available to a far larger market, which should result in a few million more sales before the end of the production of this model. (Which, BTW, should have been a clue that the current model wasn't being replaced: you don't introduce a product into new markets only to declare it superseded a few weeks later in its original market. Consumers remember things like that.)

Message.Title: The coming "battle" for 15, and a new high..
Message.Msg: With my mother having passed last night, I only have a moment, but wanted to give everyone a heads-up about what I see as the coming "battle" for 15 and then an attempt to break out to a new high and beyond. As I mentioned, the break above the 14.60-63 was the first stage of the rocket launch, and as you can see from the action so far today, we're setting up for the next stage, which is the major battle to see if the stock can get thru 15. While I can't say for sure that it will happen between now and tomorrow's close, but I certainly think it's likely, unless the market truly tanks...which I highly doubt. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Max

Message.Msg: Shares of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) are down 67 cents, or 15%, at $3.71, after Goldman Sachs’s James Covello cut his rating on the stock to Sell from Neutral, writing that the expectations on the stock are just too high relative to a weak PC market. Message.Title: Digitimes: Microsoft to launch 8 inch Surface tablet in June, with NVIDIA procesors
Message.Msg: Microsoft will launch an 8-inch Surface tablet in June and a 10.x-inch model as early as the third quarter of 2013, according to Taiwan-based supply chain makers. The 8-inch Surface will use touch panels supplied by Samsung Electronics and Nvidia-developed processors, and Taiwan-based ODM Pegatron will be responsible for production, the sources said. In consideration of clearing inventories of existing 10.6-inch Surface tablets, Microsoft will launch the 10.x-inch, possibly lower than 10.6-inch, Surface at the earliest in the third quarter, the sources indicated. Microsoft expects initial monthly shipments of the two devices to reach one million units, implying that Microsoft is more optimistic about the sales performance of the two models than of existing models, the sources said. There were 49.2 million tablets shipped globally during the first quarter of 2013 and Apple shipped 19.5 million units for a market share of 39.6%, followed by Samsung with 8.8 million units, Asustek Computer 2.7 million units, Amazon 1.8 million and Microsoft 900,000 units, the sources cited IDC statistics as indicating. SOURCE: digitimesDOTcom/news/a20130515PD213.html

Topic.Title: "Google To Announce Next Nexus 7 Tomorrow"

Message.Msg: The market has already written off the Next 7 for NVDA. At this point, tomorrow's announcement could only be neutral (likely) or positive (unlikely) for NVDA.

Topic.Title: Breaking News from: Next-gen Surface RT tablets powered by nVidia due out in June

Message.Msg: It is interesting to see an 8" RT machine from MSFT. I know many say that RT is dead, but I am curious to see whether MSFT will try to further differentiate RT as a small-form factor solution rather then trying to create an equivalency that isn't there. The "all things to all people" Windows 8 approach is, after all, part of the problem that many reviewers see with it. Android is pretty disappointing, if you try to put it up next to MacOS or Windows, but it is a phone/tablet solution so people don't expect much from it and it does really, really well at meeting those expectations. In that sense, RT could stake out a position as a more functional low-end solution... at least until INTC brings x86 to the tablet masses...

Topic.Title: Breaking News from: Next-gen Surface RT tablets powered by nVidia due out in June

Message.Msg: Hopefully they won't overcharge for the key board, and have a more effective this time?

Topic.Title: Goldman Sachs cut AMD rating from Neutral to Sell

Message.Msg: More about Goldman's downgrade of AMD: From Barrons just "Covello, like other analysts recently, notes that the company is facing potential upside in chips that are expected to go into the next Sony (SNE) PlayStation, the PS 4, as well as Microsoft‘s (MSFT) next Xbox, which is expected to be unveiled next week at the E3 video game conference: The gaming opportunity for AMD is real and indeed we believe published consensus estimates likely need to increase to incorporate gaming. However, even incorporating the expected gaming revenue and earnings, the stock is trading at 22X our new 2014 CY EPS estimate as the gaming opportunity only partially offsets the continued secular challenges in the company’s core PC business (we estimate that the PC business will generate 45% of the company’s 2013 revenue). We therefore believe this recent move in the stock is just the latest in a long history of unsustainable rallies, and we are downgrading the stock to Sell. We believe the current multiple is unjustified for any company with such significant exposure to the secularly declining PC market. Covello thinks that total gaming revenue in 2014 could be $960 million, based on total “application processor unit” shipments of 12 million units. However, Covello sees AMD losing share in PC chips amidst a troubled market, with shipments dropping to 153.5 million this year from 157.7 million last year: PC business remains a headwind. Our model assumes that AMD continues to lose market share in the core PC market, and we assume AMD’s share of PC client processors declines to 13% in 2014 from 17% in 2012 (Exhibit 3). We believe our view on AMD’s share in the PC client business is below consensus. We expect AMD will lose further share in the performance areas of the market to Intel, as we believe Intel’s integrated design and manufacturing allows it to more quickly ramp leading edge products. In power-sensitive applications, we believe AMD will lose share to new ARM-based entrants.....

Message.Title: PCPerspective: The floodgates are open on Tegra 4 with HP's Slatebook X2.....
Message.Msg: ""The floodgates are open on Tegra 4 with HP announcing their SlateBook x2 hybrid tablet just a single day after NVIDIA's SHIELD move out of the projects. The SlateBook x2 uses the Tegra 4 processor to power Android 4.2.2 Jellybean along with the full Google experience including the Google Play store. Along with Google Play, the SlateBook and its Tegra 4 processor are also allowed in TegraZone and NVIDIA's mobile gaming ecosystem. As for the device itself, it is a 10.1" Android tablet which can dock into a keyboard for extended battery life, I/O ports, and well, a hardware keyboard. You are able to attach this tablet to a TV via HDMI along with the typical USB 2.0, combo audio jack, and a full-sized SD card slot; which half any given port is available through is anyone's guess, however. Wirelessly, you have WiFi a/b/g/n and some unspecified version of Bluetooth. The raw specifications list follows: NVIDIA Tegra 4 SoC ARM Cortex A15 quad core @ 1.8 GHz 72 "Core" GeForce GPU @ ~672MHz, 96 GFLOPS 2GB DDR3L RAM ("Starts at", maybe more upon customization?) 64GB eMMC SSD 1920x1200 10.1" touch-enabled IPS display HDMI output 1080p rear camera, 720p front camera with integrated microphone 802.11a/b/g/n + Bluetooth (4.0??) Combo audio jack, USB 2.0, SD Card reader Android 4.2.2 w/ Full Google and TegraZone experiences. SOURCE: pcperDOTcom/news/General-Tech/HP-SlateBook-x2-Tegra-4-Android-422-August ____ PS: Love their wording of "floodgate on Tegra 4....". A nice summary of specs as well.

Message.Title: The Next NFLX...
Message.Msg: The #1 Netflix (NFLX) alternative play in the market today is Concurrent (CCUR)! This stock has the #1 best chance on the NASDAQ to quickly double in the short-term! CCUR's EPS has been ramping up faster than any other small-cap technology stock with their quarterly GAAP EPS rising over the past year on a quarter-to-quarter basis from $0.02, to $0.04, to $0.08, and to $0.11. This equals EPS growth over the past four quarters of 450%! CCUR is trading for $7.09 per share with 8.75mm shares outstanding, a market cap of $62.07mm, cash of $22.37mm, an enterprise value of $39.7mm, and trailing 12 month revenues of $63.23mm! CCUR is the pay-TV industry's #1 VOD and multi-screen video delivery solutions company with many huge loyal clients including Time Warner Cable, Cox, Charter, Bright House, and Virgin Media. CCUR's new breakthrough multi-screen CDN video delivery platform allows pay-TV service providers to combine their classic RF-based VOD infrastructure with their new IP-based content delivery networks (CDNs) to deliver VOD TV shows and movies to tablets, smartphones, and other IP connected mobile devices, while quickly and cost effectively expanding the number of on demand videos they can offer! CCUR's CDN technology is now delivering VOD content to the iOS and Android smartphones/tablets of Time Warner Cable's 12 million subscribers! Almost nobody knows this yet, but word will spread very rapidly!

Message.Title: NVIDIA Shield featured on ABC's "Modern Family"
Message.Msg: Nvidia SHIELD Featured on ABC's Modern Family "Those of us who aren’t in sitcoms still have to wait until June to get our hands on a SHIELD and find out if Nvidia really does have a winner on its hands or not, but it seems that Luke Dunphy has made his choice in the portable console war, even if it was probably only due to a corporate deal with Nvidia to promote the system’s portability." (Culture, Mobile, Nvidia Shield) n4gDOTcom/news/1255535/nvidia-shield-featured-on-abcs-modern-family (Note: Several other websites also carried the story. NVIDIA spokesman said that there was no money changing hands either way. The producer of the show asked NV for a unit as he was at the CES meeting in January, and was immensely impressed with the Shield. Needless to say that this guy must be well-versed in tech as well as in gaming to be able to appreciate Shield's attributes.)
